posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Hey guys, Quick question, I have a camera stream running on a mjpeg server. I have the link to the mjpeg stream, what do I do to put the stream on shuffleboard? Am I supposed to use cameraserver? Thanks

posts.name: Emre
posts.cooked: I think first run CameraServer.startAutomaticCapture(); then drag and drop to shuffleboard from left panel

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Where is the automatic capture getting the stream from? Our camera isn’t directly connected to our rio using usb, so I don’t know if that would work correctly

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: If you’re running something custom, the way you get it to show up on Shuffleboard is to either use ShuffleboardContainer.addCamera or to add it to the camera selectable list by publishing a streams topic to NT like what CameraServer does.

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: How is addCamera used? When I try to use ShuffleboardContainer.addCamera with the name and link to the camera stream in the Robot.java initialize function, it gives me the error that I can’t make a static reference to a non static function. Is there any example code I can refer to?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
Unlike SmartDashboard, data cannot be sent directly to Shuffleboard without first specifying what tab the data should be placed in. Sending simple data: Sending simple data (numbers, strings, boole...

Something like this in the Robot constructor:

Note this will put the camera on a separate tab.  Unfortunately, I don’t believe shuffleboard has a way to just display a raw URL camera stream without using a code-driven layout or using the camera list, but using CameraServer with a HttpCamera should work to get the camera added to the Shuffleboard camera list:

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Hey! So we used the CameraServer in the Robotinit for our code, and we confirmed the static http link we sent to the cameraserver was providing a mjpeg stream, but we can’t find the stream on our shuffleboard anywhere. It should be under cameraServer tab right? It’s not returning a invalid link error or anything either so I don’t believe there’s something wrong with the link?

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: github.com Happyjog/3984-Reefscape-v1/blob/spittertemp/Reefscape/src/main/java/frc/robot/Robot.java // Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors. // Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of // the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project. package frc.robot; //import com.pathplanner.lib.server.PathPlannerServer; import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.TimedRobot; import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.shuffleboard.ShuffleboardContainer; import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command; import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler; import frc.robot.lib.config.CTREConfigs; import au.grapplerobotics.CanBridge; import edu.wpi.first.cameraserver.CameraServer; import edu.wpi.first.cscore.HttpCamera; import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.TimedRobot; /** * The VM is configured to automatically run this class, and to call the functions corresponding to This file has been truncated. show original

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
Three things to check:

Use OutlineViewer to verify the camera is listed in NT under the /CameraPublisher table (this will only be the case if you use the startAutomaticCapture(HttpCamera) approach)

Upgrade WPILib tools to 2025.3.2 (run the installer again).  There were issues in the first couple of Shuffleboard releases

Try a different dashboard (eg Elastic) and see if it appears there
